definition: lit. to lead away a goat while passing by (idiom)/fig. to opportunistically pocket sb's possessions and walk off
to obey/to follow/to arrange/to make reasonable/along/favorable
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
to lead along/to pull (an animal on a tether)/(bound form) to involve/to draw in

sentences.english: Don't tell me it was a five-finger discount .
sentences.chinese: 别跟我说那是顺手牵羊偷来的。

sentences.english: He helped himself to the book when nobody noticed him.
sentences.chinese: 他趁人不注意把这本书顺手牵羊了。

sentences.english: He made off with a computer.
sentences.chinese: 他顺手牵羊带走了一台电脑。
千万不要再在商店顺手牵羊了。

sentences.english: She picked up the new nylon umbrella on the sly.
sentences.chinese: 她顺手牵羊拿走了那顶新尼龙伞。

sentences.english: He walked away with both my pen and the lighter.
sentences.chinese: 他顺手牵羊把我的钢笔和打火机都拿走了。

definition: insect that damages cereal crop seedlings/(lit. and fig.) vermin/a person harmful to the country and the people
to take advantage of sb in an unguarded moment (idiom)/to take sb by surprise
to return something to its rightful owner
to lose by theft/to have one's property stolen
